According to the report If greenhouse gas emissions are not cut drastically and rapidly, between 2030-52, Earths global average temperatures could rise by 1.5 degree above pre-industrial era levels, leading to widespread climate change‚impacts. The scientists summarised that the already recorded rise of 1 degree in global average temperatures has led to substantial impacts. According to scientists a rise in global temperatures by another 0.5 degree Celsius would increase, deepen and spread the impacts wider.

Currently, renewable power capacity in India is 20% of installed capacity. The countrys forest area rose by 1% over two years till 2017, covering 24% of India. Only 24% of the countrys solid waste collected annually by municipalities is processed.

The goal is simple. Carbon dioxide is the climates worst enemy. Its released when oil, coal, and other fossil fuels are burned for energy”the energy we use to power our homes, cars, and smartphones. By using less of it, we can curb our own contribution to climate change while also saving money.
